function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Emphasis on flexibility of buildings may lead to increased transmission of contagious diseases within the residential area.","Impact":"Higher risk of contagion and spread of diseases among residents due to design features.","Mitigation":"Implementing stricter hygiene and sanitation measures, as well as introducing guidelines for ventilation and air circulation within buildings.","Technologies":"Use of air purifiers, UV germicidal lamps, and smart ventilation systems to improve indoor air quality and reduce the risk of disease transmission.","People":"Residents of the multi-family buildings, especially those living in densely populated areas.","Owner":"Architects, urban planners, and building developers."},{"Description":"Lack of consideration for distancing and segregation within the residential area may contribute to the spread of contagious diseases.","Impact":"Increased likelihood of disease transmission due to close proximity and lack of segregation measures.","Mitigation":"Incorporating design elements that promote physical distancing, such as creating communal spaces with adequate spacing and implementing traffic flow guidelines within the buildings.","Technologies":"Use of contactless systems for access control and building amenities, as well as smart building management systems to monitor and regulate occupancy levels.","People":"Local authorities, architects, and building management teams.","Owner":"Local authorities, building developers, and property managers."},{"Description":"Inadequate consideration for the use and maintenance of communal areas may lead to increased risk of disease transmission.","Impact":"Higher potential for contamination and disease spread in shared spaces within the residential area.","Mitigation":"Implementing regular cleaning and disinfection protocols for communal areas, as well as promoting education and awareness among residents regarding safe usage and maintenance practices.","Technologies":"Installation of touchless facilities, antimicrobial surfaces, and IoT-based monitoring systems for tracking cleanliness and occupancy of communal areas.","People":"Residents utilizing communal areas, building maintenance staff, and property managers.","Owner":"Property managers, building maintenance teams, and technology providers."}]}
